sources.data_found: With 440 Bachelor's, 129 Master's, and 16 Ph.D. graduates in computer science, computer engineering, information technology, and cybersecurity in the academic year 2023-24. With an enrollment of 670 students, this program is seeing rapid growth.
230 Total Graduate Students; 67% International Breakout (representing other countries) Male (73%) Female (26%)

During the 2021-2022 academic year, University of South Florida - Main Campus handed out 480 bachelor's degrees in computer & information sciences. In 2022, 257 students received their master's degree in computer & information sciences from USF Tampa.

student_data.notes: Undergraduate CS count estimated from: 480 bachelor's degrees awarded in 2021-22 (from collegefactual.com) × 4 years = 1,920. The CSE department website notes 670 students in cybersecurity program with rapid growth, plus 440 Bachelor's graduates across CS/CpE/IT/Cybersecurity in 2023-24. Graduate MS count estimated from: 257 MS degrees in 2022 (collegefactual.com) × 2 years average completion = 514, plus data showing 230 total graduate students (petersons.com). PhD count estimated from: 16 PhD graduates in 2023-24 (CSE website) × 5 years average = 80 PhD students.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: USF has multiple GPU clusters: RRA cluster with 120 GPUs, CIRCE cluster with 171 GPUs, and a dedicated AI/data science cluster with 145 high-end NVIDIA GPUs across 27 nodes (from NSF CRI grant). Total = 120 + 171 + 145 = 436 GPUs. Specific models not publicly disclosed beyond mention of 'very high-end GPU NVIDIA processors' and Tesla K20 mentioned in SLURM documentation.
SLURM documentation shows constraint option for 'gpu_K20' model. Tesla K20 has 5GB GDDR5 memory. Count not specified in public documentation.

gpu_resources.notes: USF operates multiple GPU-enabled clusters: 1) RRA cluster: 120 GPUs across 77 nodes, 2) CIRCE cluster: 171 GPUs (main research cluster), 3) NSF-funded AI/data science cluster: 145 high-end NVIDIA GPUs across 27 nodes with 2.6TB aggregated GPU memory. Total GPU count across all clusters = 436. Specific GPU models and counts by model are not publicly detailed in documentation, though Tesla K20 is mentioned in SLURM configuration. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

analysis_notes: USF has significant GPU computing resources with 436 total GPUs across three major clusters (RRA, CIRCE, and NSF CRI-funded). However, specific GPU model breakdowns are not publicly available. Student counts are estimated from graduation data and enrollment figures, showing approximately 2,516 total CS students across all degree levels.
